website_summaries.verdict: Although a bit pricey, it's a good choice for parents and kids who want a large screen with exceptional graphics combined with the latest technology.
pros: An updated kids' Fire tablet with a 10.1 inch screen and beautiful full HD graphics that make it an excellent pick for video watching and game playing
Offers a speedy 1.8 GHz processor and 32GB internal storage
cons: Larger build may be a bit awkward for small hands
The most expensive model on our list

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet !!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old love her new New FreeTime 10th edition. She previously had the 7th edition and I can say that the difference is quite big I’m glad I upgraded her!
customer_reviews.author: nathalia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! It is definitely big, but so light and we'll made. Great for movies and apps! My 2 year old can even navigate it well! My 5 year old loves it, so does mom! Fast and so many great books, apps and shows! Not cheesy ones, the ones you would pay for! Very fast and I put only what I want on the boys profiles. Actually just bought a second one yesterday!
customer_reviews.author: lindseymae

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy and poor memory
customer_reviews.text: Super glitchy like it’s stuck I will have to return. Also I suggest getting a good memory card as mine filled up so fast and I ha d a 32gig and it still wasn’t enough to hold apps and books . It so unfortunate because up until it’s froze it was better then my last tablet but it started glitching after only a week ... so upset and so is my child ...
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: No YouTube
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use as an AAC Device (communication device) AND for her to watch videos on YouTube. I'm pleased with it otherwise, but am very disappointed to find out that I can't use it for one of the main things I needed it for. I chose this for the price and the nice case, but had I read the reviews further and known, I would have opted to spend a little more money on something that would have allowed the YouTube app. It actually says YouTube in the product description, so someone should edit that. I'm considering returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Screen is made horrible
customer_reviews.text: If I can give 0 stars I would. My kids always had IPads for years never broke the screen. They would drop it many times and still the screen would never crack. My child got the fire hd 10 kids edition as a gift and already had to replace it twice within a month. Was dropped slightly off the couch on a rug both times and the screen cracked like a spider web. I would not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Viper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for kids...and adults
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our daughter as an upgrade to her old 7” Fire; think I love it more than her! It keeps her busy and learning and offers us the ability limit her time on it. Amazon did an amazing job on its devices and already ordered one for myself. Adult version of course!
customer_reviews.author: James Frederick Green

customer_reviews.title: Turn off auto update...now!!
customer_reviews.text: This was an okay tablet until it updated last week. Now it's worthless. They took away the web functionality in the freetime mode. You literally can't navigate to a website now. I chatted with Amazon about it and was told to navigate the web as a regular user, but there are no parental controls then. The charging port is difficult for an adult to use let alone a child. The freetime section is full of bugs and interface problems. Games don't work right or don't fit on the screen correctly. I see nowhere to provide feedback to report problems with individual apps and games.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: Washable cover. My son colored the cover with markers and I was horrified. But it washed off with ease. Very happy. I like being able to monitor his usage.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor product
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this because it seemed awesome. A tablet specified for kids with a Free year of Freetome for kids. I have had this since September and my daughter has hardly used it because half this time it does this crap! It’s so buggy and glitchy. If it’s not allowing us to click on anything it will go to a blue screen that says “oops something went wrong try again” and even restarting it doesn’t work. I’ll have to wait DAYS before it starts up again. I also bought 3 others for my nieces and nephews. Now thing of just contact Amazon and returning them all.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great tablets!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my girls (2 & 6)... I love the size and the fact that there is so much for them to do with the unlimited free time. I have already had to send one back...all of a sudden it became very grainy, not clear ( not even a week of having it). The exchange was simple and my daughter had her tablet back in 2 days! Would definitely recommend. Battery life could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Trena J

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids and light in weight.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bundle for my son, who is six years old, and daughter, who is two years old, and it was a great price for the two tablets. My children LOVE them! The tablets have a really big screen and they are surprisingly light in weight. The bumpers are sturdy and durable. I love that the Kindle can go from the parent profile to the kids' profiles. I purchased two Nabi's before and they were not nearly as good as the Kindle. It is very easy for my children to navigate. I would definitely recommend anyone to buy for their kids.
customer_reviews.author: Roshelle Scully

customer_reviews.title: PAINFULLY UNUSABLE!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but a pain to setup. The parental controls make it unusable for the parent. I wish I could return the two tablets I purchased, but unfortunately I was unable to unpackage and set them up until after the return window closed. You cannot imagine how much I regret purchasing these tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Cat McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Kids are pleased
customer_reviews.text: We bought a 2 pack of the kindle fire 10s before a 25 hour round trip road trip. Both kids (3 + 5) have iPads, but they are older versions and we can’t really put new apps on them. The kindle seemed like a more affordable option over buying both kids a new iPad. Setting up the kindles was very frustrating and time consuming, I thought there could have been an easier way. Overall, now that they’ve been set up and we’ve taken the 25 hour trip it was a total lifesaver. The kids enjoyed the variety of the apps and having some of their favorite shows downloaded!
customer_reviews.author: Misty Z

customer_reviews.title: This thing can get really loud. just FYI
customer_reviews.text: While we love the fire and this is the 3rd version we have purchased. We absolutely hate how loud this thing can get. It's deafening ! Our child is able to accidentally turn up the volume, not sure how, but let's face it I didn't buy this thing for them so I can sit there and watch them play it. hehehe... anyhow, I have to pull over the car and turn it down if their older sibling isn't in the car and it's a little frustrating. Other than a few glitchy apps it seems good. No cracks or sign of wear yet.
customer_reviews.author: YeowMeow

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: These Fire Kids Edition tablets are a MUST HAVE. This one is a lot bigger than I was expecting, but it’s still so worth it. From the educational goals, to the time limits, the books, the learning games, the WiFi free downloads for on the go use... it’s just perfect for developing little minds. I won’t ever buy any different type of tablet for my son in the future. I also love that it has the option to have multiple profiles and can be a regular tablet for the adults too. 10/10 Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Bhusal

customer_reviews.title: Great item maybe usability updates.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great item. You dont need internet for a lot of the apps as long as they are fully downloaded. The one problem I have is when you go the download items for the child, they dont have an option to have all the items downloaded on the home screen. My child is still confused that he has to go to the different sections at the top when we upload new items and push out the games we like to play. You should be able to scroll different sections of downloads top to bottom then across for all those downloaded in the section
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the 2 year "worry-free" warranty really exist?  I can not find anyway to initiate this.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet pre order. It has been great, but then it won't charge. I have tried quick fixes. The return button will not work. The repair tab will not work. My choices are limited to review and archive. This tablet is under the 2 year "worry free" warranty. This has been far from "worry free". Please send me information and contact information for how to get this tablet repaired or replaced. I will return here to update the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Sacheen Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS TABLET. The number 1 feature is how may times it will crash on a daily basis. Fourth Fire Kids Tablet I have gotten in the last 2 years(1st one from Amazon, 2nd one from Best Buy, 3rd from Best Buy, and this time we 'upgraded' to this one from Amazon and same BS keeps happening). No matter what, it works for about 30 minutes and needs a reset. EVERY SINGLE TIME. That is assuming the apps will even open. I have more than 75% of storage space left and it still lags like you're waiting for a PS1 game to boot. Pathetic. Spend the extra money and get a REAL tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha M

customer_reviews.title: The Kids Fire HD is TOO EXPENSIVE for the charging port to NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this product. I spent $172.00 it arrived brand new in the package and something is wrong with the charging port. I have been trying to contact some one for instructions on how to send it back but have had NO SUCCESS. My daughter needs this for school but l can't even get it exchanged or fixed. I'm truly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MONET O.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Get an iPad
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months the first tablet we bought stopped holding a charge. I contacted customer service, and after talking me thought attempts to reboot the machine and changing charging cords, they said they would just replace it. So, I was happy to get a replacement thinking it was an anomaly. Well, 7 months later the second Fire tablet is doing the same thing, Online forums suggest it is the charging port is defective. They will not repair or replace it a second time. Guess I wasted my money on something that only lasts 6 months. I have an iPad 3 that still works like a charm after 10 years, I'll only ever buy iPads again despite the high price.
customer_reviews.author: LRL Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Need to know for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this device, it’s case, the warranty, and the FreeTime free year trial is AMAZING. The only downside is for those who can’t read yet. We got this for our toddler who LOVES books but with a new baby around we don’t always have time to sit and read all the books he has so we thought this would be so fun for him to “read books” on his new tablet BUT none of the books are audio! Huge bummer because I’m not going to buy the audio version of 50 books. Especially when the audible app on Amazon is ONLY the audio without the book pictures and words... weird
customer_reviews.author: Abby Swinderman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work right
customer_reviews.text: we are getting a “oops something went wrong” message on a daily basis now and to get rid of it we have to restart the tablet and it happens more than once a day, my son doesn’t use it that much anymore mostly because he can’t use it due to the error message, and this is the replacement tablet, the original one we bought did the exact same thing, we had to replace it because my son had dropped it and broke the screen, I will be contacting amazon and try to get my money back
customer_reviews.author: jose paez

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to use and simple to get to work with goggle app store. The free time is pretty awesome and my daughter loves it and at 2.99 a month for prime members after the free year is completely worth it. Not to mention the case and the 2 year no questions asked return and replace warranty is worrh it alone. (Did buy during prime day sale so even better deal than standard 😀) But would still pay full price anyday.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Amazon needs to update! Then everything would be 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: ***much needed update on review 7/29/19*** Freetime is working as it should and my son can use this tablet like normal. He loves this thing and I love it and trust this for him. Best investment I’ve made. This is an awesome tablet and glad I purchased this over the competitors. The idea is great, but doesn’t fulfill. It is buggy, slow and my son can’t use the tablet the way it was made to.. I really wanted to love it but even after the most recent free time update, the apps still don’t load. Amazon keeps changing how FreeTime is set up for the kids and it’s not kid friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids, and you can't beat the warranty!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is so cool for my 6 year old! He can play Minecraft, ABC Mouse, watch Netflix, and there are so many books to read on freetime, I could read him a new story every night! It's surprisingly lightweight. The battery seems great too, and really helps on long road trips. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Child approved, easy to use, small/no complaints
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. The battery life lasts for close to 24 hours. You can download books, put parental control. Your child needs your permission to access any apps you might want them to have. My only downfall is that you cant connect it to have internet unless theres wifi in your vicinity. You have to download videos and pretty much anythi ng if you want to use it on a road trip. BUT with a memory card, you can download some of your kids favorite shows like pj masks, sesame place, mickey mouse movies. You can also download movies/shows on your netflix account and watch it later. The camera quality is not great, at all.
customer_reviews.author: Leonides

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful learning tool for toddler!
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love this tablet! My 1 year old (now 2) has used this every day for the last year. An instant fix everytime he was fussy or mommy just needed a moment! My husband and I don't know what we would have done without this tablet. And it's not just entertainment, my son has learned his alphabet, numbers, colors, animals, and so much more from having daily use with this. Constant screen time isn't good, but the right screen time can be great! Im sure we will continue using this tablet as a learning tool for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Shovan Reese

customer_reviews.title: Fire 10 Kids Tablet
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son absolutely loves his tablet. I understand I could separately purchase the tablet, and the protective cover, but I went with this package for the 2 year guarantee. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I can’t figure out how to close the apps on my sons account. There does not seem to be an option so I don’t know if they are closing out when he backs out or if they are just stacking up. He has had it about one month and loves all the games and videos. I enjoy that it has parental controls and shows age appropriate content. I would recommend buying this as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: Becomes defective after very little use!
customer_reviews.text: The ratings are by far misleading. I bought two, and my mother in law bought us a third one. One tablet stopped working within a month of using it. The second one stopped within less than a full year of using it. The tablet that my mother in law purchased for us was only used twice, then stopped working. The screen starts to discolor, then all of a sudden, it will not turn on anymore. These devices have not been dropped, were not affected by water or any spillage. It became defective after very little use. For the price of these devices, I am, very unhappy. I will change my review if I am able to do an even exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Live Life Hapily

customer_reviews.title: Lsrge, b ignorant display and included apps are great!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this tablet! It replaced her Nabi tablet, and the difference is truly remarkable. This tablet is much bigger, much brighter, the display is wonderful and there are no buttons to accidentally hit that might change the tabs or turn the tablet on or off. Th included apps are educational, the easy links to parental controls are great and there are no complaints from her or the adults supervising her.
customer_reviews.author: Made in Malone

customer_reviews.title: Good but.....
customer_reviews.text: I love the tablets and the free time it has on it. However I bought these for educational purposes and this tablet is not compatible with lexia core 5 ☹️. Also I already had to send back one of the pink ones due to some technical problems but thank goodness for the warranty I’m just hoping it comes back fast cause my daughter is upset that her siblings have their tablets and she doesn’t ☹️.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: charging port
customer_reviews.text: I have already returned the tablet once for the charging port being to lose to charge any more. We originally bought in April 2019 returned in June 2019 by October 2019 cant charge it again. For a childs tablet this is poor planning and management of a device. I will return it again because for $200 my kid needs to be able to use it for longer than 2 or 3 months, but it is ridiculous that it only works that long before being replaced. we have 3 children with 3 tablets and every one of them have been replaced once for the same reason. This particular one is ready for the 2nd replacement. RIDICULOUS!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: HUGE Screen!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these are awesome! We were upgrading from the 7 and I was surprised at how much larger the screen is!! I do miss the smaller size tablet for easy carry but my kids are getting older so this is something that they can grow with. Very nice
customer_reviews.author: Delgado_since_2005

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my kids at the end of July 2018. They've had to be replaced TWICE. Its the end of September 2018. They haven't worked right from the beginning. I'm having to call Amazon AGAIN. I've been a Prime customer for 10 years and NEVER had an issue like this!
customer_reviews.author: N R Baker

customer_reviews.title: Helicopter parent approved
customer_reviews.text: As an Apple centric user I do find the fire tablets a little confusing but I’m sure with some use we will understand. Truthfully I couldn’t say enough about the parental controls and how customizable they are- specifically how they separate educational vs entertainment and you can set goals for kids to do x amount of minutes within educational apps/ audible books/ etc before doing entertainment stuff. This product makes the Helicopter parent in me so happy and feel incredibly comfortable with my kids having a tablet. Also- the fact that they aren’t holding a $500+ iPad that they can crack the screen is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!  Free time app is only good part of it.  Can get separately
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to figure out how to add programming for child. Quality of everything is not great. The bumper is good, the free time app is nice; you have access to games you’d otherwise have to pay individually for. The charging port is already loose and has difficulty charging. Will DEFINITELY not purchase again. iPad will be our next tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Won’t even let me set it up..
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it 0 stars, I would. It started with the delivery date continuously being pushed back until it came 2 days AFTER Christmas. Once received, it won’t get past the start up screen before crashing or freezing. It just continuously restarts itself. Customer service was no help, telling me to hold the on/off button and asking questions about the device that would require the device to actually turn on for me to know. They’re sending a replacement so let’s see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: BUYERS BEWARE....
customer_reviews.text: So this tablet starts out great! Then on freetime it freezes up and you have to shut it down and start it over! This is a pain. And from what I'm seeing this is not being addressed yet! Really wish amazon would fix this issue!?!
customer_reviews.author: LIS

customer_reviews.title: User unfriendly. Limited downloads
customer_reviews.text: I’m 30 years old and grew up with technology. I take pride in knowing how to use new tech. This is the most user unfriendly touch screen I have used. I downloaded movies for my son to watch on our 5 day road trip. But they don’t move into the kids section. They only stay in the adult users spot. And I had to amazon tech support to just find the area where downloaded movies were! Amazon also limits ur downloads to a device to something like 20. So some tv shows that have 2 minute epsiodes mean u only get 20 of those on ur device. Why!? This is just obsurd.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter (Age 3) And travel. And I would ultimately use it during the day. The picture quality is going as compared to our old fire HD seve and travel. And I would ultimately use it during the day. The picture quality is going as compared to our old fire HD 7 - But not a drastic difference in quality just screen size. The battery life is disappointing though. If we both use it during the day, I will ultimately have to charge it that night because it will be low.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Glad we went with this over ipad
customer_reviews.text: We are apple users, but we wanted the most control over our child's tablet usage. The tablet is not perfect, but it's part darn close. Having the ability to manage screen time and what type of screen activity is a major plus. We are on our honeymoon and I can alter his viewing habits from my cell phone. I like that I can mandate educational before entertainment, however I disagree with what amazon considers educational, such as reading a book about how to play a video game. It's not perfect, but it does what we need it to do, especially while we are away on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: AJG

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: My kids have owned kindles for a while. They've never been very good. I keep buying them because they are cheaper than other tablets. Until my kids are a little older the kindle will have to do. So I guess you get what you pay for. They are extremely slow and glitchy. The kids get booted out of their apps constantly. It's a hassle trying to add apps and games on each profile. I know it isn't my internet connection because we don't have a single problem with any of our other electronics. Plus their kindles have always been a pain no matter whose wifi they are connected to.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Freetime is cool, but four of four tablets had to be returned due to poor charger connection
customer_reviews.text: Kids love these, and Amazon does a great job with the Freetime unlimited package and all the parental and age controls. That said - we bought four of these, and less than a year in we have had to exchange all four of them because the charger connection (USB port) in the tablet is poorly made and designed, and will eventually get loose and break. 100% failure at this point on four tablets. Not good. Amazon replaced them under their warranty but informed us that we won't be able to replace them again, and it will certainly happen again. Don't let kids play with them when plugged in because the USB connector is so weak and poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Tried to get 2 for our twins for Christmas. One didn’t work. We returned it. It got sent back with no kid-friendly case and no adapter. The customer service representative insisted that we needed to order more equipment (even though we just did not receive everything back we ordered). She asked us to be placed on hold for 2 minutes. It has been 10 minutes (and over a 30 min conversation). Horrible customer service. Product, no idea, wish we knew (no, we haven’t given the other twin the tablet...that would create more bad than good)
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice little tablet but after less than a month the apps started glitching my kids couldn’t even use it. The games wouldn’t open or it would stop working and get stuck. I would have to turn it off and restart it. I ended up returning and getting my money back.
customer_reviews.author: regina

customer_reviews.title: Charge overnight because you'll age faster than it'll charge
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son and he loved it. I mean crazy loved it. Helped with his behavior because we told him he couldn't use it if he was bad or not listening. The good stuff. Lots of apps Lasts long between charges Bumpers help protect from falls Lots of ways to limit use Easy to lockout unwanted purchases The bad stuff Charge time on this this is TERRIBLE The USB port is hard to access Did I mention the charge time SUCKS The charging port died CHARGING IS SLOW!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tely

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I have had two 10-inch kindles. I like to use them to read graphic novels and do Microsoft Office, but the batteries never last. The first battery lasted a little more than a year and the one I purchased December 2018 is no longer fully charging. I have been letting it fully discharge since July. This worked with my oldest kindle which still works. I often carry two kindles with me in case my bus to work gets stuck in traffic with two slightly different things to read or watch. I would really like a reliable battery in the larger kindles and/or changeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Kitty Mama

customer_reviews.title: Buy a real tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my kids. They are the biggest pile of junk. Constantly crashing and locking up, which creates whiny kids and frustration for parents. I regret spending $399 on these, should’ve just bought a real tablet like Samsung or iPad. If I could do it over again, I wouldn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Friendly! Easy to Use! Easy to Manage.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well! Worth every dime. I have an iPhone and all I have to do is download FreeTime on my phone and I can easily pause their devices when it’s time for dinner or when we’re all watching a movie together. They don’t get upset because they see the moon or kid friendly pause button and know that their Tablets need a break. My kids are 2 and 3 and they are able to navigate everything just fine after adjusting from using my iPad.
customer_reviews.author: TexasSweetheart

customer_reviews.title: Continues to disconnect from WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a nice upgrade for my daughter, she's been using a 7" for the past few years. Her school applications suggested a 10" tablet and since we've been happy with the 7" I didn't hesitate with this purchase. What a mistake. She cannot use her profile because it drops off the WiFi no stop. Now if we stay under the parent profile it works but she cannot access Amazon Free Time under the parents profile and her school applications are not supported for some reason. I cannot find a phone number to call for support and the endless searching for help online is VERY FRUSTRATING!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Poelking

customer_reviews.title: Software glitch: oops something went wrong.
customer_reviews.text: It is ok but 10 times in a day it will stop working with “oops, something went wrong” message and have to reboot it. Lots of software glitch. It would be great if fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Tech

customer_reviews.title: If you like broken glass
customer_reviews.text: No kidding I have had to have these replaced over 8 times. The screen cracks so easily! I fully believe the size of the tablet is too large for the quality of the glass they used. It got worse and worse because each time you replace they send you a refurbished one. Not worth it. They wouldn't refund me but I did manage to get them to comp fire 8's in exchange because they were useless constantly breaking. Not really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: inusaki

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome tablet! The picture quality is fantastic, the sound equally great! I got this for my son who turned 9 and he is autistic. He absolutely loved it! Its huge and surprisingly very lightweight. The price is extremely affordable, the worry free gaurentee sealed the deal for me. I love Amazon and we have purchased a few different kindles from them and this is by far the best one yet. He gets all the apps he likes including youtube. Will actually be purchasing another. Watching hulu, Netflix or prime videos on this tablet is awesome. The screen is huge, and the resolution is super clear.
customer_reviews.author: kristen31

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The battery is very bad. Have to charge it every day. Also very glitchy. I need to restart it every time my kid wants to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Too much effort to manage interface
customer_reviews.text: As a parent I’m always having to haggle with this interface to manage apps and sign into new WiFi networks. I have 2 kids and its double the management... it’s way too much work getting kids stuff they want, especially things like prime video kids movies, which is why I bought this... I can not recommend the interface for this tablet.. if you want simplicity move on
customer_reviews.author: Matt the Man

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service, decent product, does not include free time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Fire Kids Edition 7" model a few years ago, it was great got my 1 year FreeTime. Upgraded this year with the newer model that includes 1 year of FreeTime. I never got my 1 free year and was charged 2 months in a row. Contacted amazon support which has always been great in the past. 40 minutes and 4 people later issue wasn't resolved and I decided to return it. The tablet itself seems nice and has great battery life. Horrible and inept customer service has me returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good deal good price good product
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. I like the big screen and the bumper case. My 5 and 7 year old beat the heck out of these. And so far so good. I am liking the Amazon Freetime program as well, I am not paranoid that they will inadvertently find their way to the internet and Order lots of things for other mischief. The pre loaded programs on Amazon Freetime are nice as well, there are tons for my kids to pick from and I know they're all okay.
customer_reviews.author: Super Autism MOM

customer_reviews.title: HORRENDOUS battery life and charge time
customer_reviews.text: The battery life and charge tune on this device is absolutely appalling, it takes an entire day to fully charge it which is really fun when a little one is waiting to play with it. Also once charged it dies in hours. I do think it’s age appropriate and there are a lot of fun apps for kids but the constant fight with the battery issues overshadows all of it
customer_reviews.author: Jessie C

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet unfortunate compromises
customer_reviews.text: The inability to use sideloaded apps in free time sucks. I had to set my older child up so he uses the tablet without free time because of apps not in Amazon's market place that he uses frequently. Other than that it's a great tablet at a great price for a child.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pape

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but...
customer_reviews.text: I love that tablet, 2 starts because they need to work on the kids menu, it’s not kids friendly , also they need to update to type c usb charger because the micro usb it’s so fragile,kids just pull it off and breaks. it’s really easy to break!..the case is amazing...the speakers too loud , the screen crystal clear, it holds a charge of up to 8-9 hours of use ... highly recommended. Update review Tablet still working but battery now last 2-3 hours ! From 100 % charge to 0%
customer_reviews.author: Nikos  batsos

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old boy loves it
customer_reviews.text: My little boy is nearly 2 at the time of this writing and uses this thing all day. He also uses it on road trips and in the airplane, where it's a lifesaver. I upgraded to this product from the 8 inch model and am happy about doing so. Battery life is reasonable but will not last all day with heavy use. Might want to keep an external battery handy. FreeTime membership is a must otherwise the tablet will have little value.
customer_reviews.author: Discreet User

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm I wouldn’t ..
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this product twice. Once I believe I purchased the version 8 and after some time. It became very very slow, the touch screen function was not working properly. It just didn’t function well overall after a few months. Then I upgraded to the 10 for my three year old and once again, initially it was fine. After a few months, it became very slow and just didn’t function well. My son would have to press apps several times and the screen wouldn’t work properly. I think this table is a generally a great idea but they have to fix a few things ! I’m not purchasing this tablet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big and beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Very good tablet for my child (age 4). She has a little trouble navigating it, but she is pretty young still. It is a big, beautiful, brilliant screen. Set up was way easier than I was expecting. One of my only gripes is (and it is minor) that the charging port is micro USB instead of USB-C. It would just be better for smaller uncoordinated hands to plug in. I highly recommend this for kids of just about any age!
customer_reviews.author: Yeti

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: My son is Autistic, and loves anything electronic (mainly PCs, tablets, phones, etc etc), but my issue with giving him one always was that there was way too much "freedom" for him to access things that aren't appropriate for him to access. This tablet with the Free Time Unlimited was the perfect choice for him. He's loving it so far, and he still has "freedom" while not having the ability to access anything that isn't kid-friendly. I love how I'm able to monitor his usage from practically anywhere, and either permit or deny things that I deem appropriate or inappropriate. Definitely a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: SpunkyB

customer_reviews.title: Works but has some kinks
customer_reviews.text: We bought this and the interface is buggy. Apps consistently crash. Try to add videos to the child's profile from Amazon video and it won't open. Switch to the parent profile and the same problem, open the Amazon video app, try to open any show and it crashes. We've reset it and it still does the same thing. Hopefully the provide an update. It's frustrating when trying to use the Kindle for long road trips and you can't use it as intended offline.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 6 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my 6 year old, and he loves it! Must say it was EASY to set up, just enter a little information, and we were off! There are so many games, audible books, LEARNING GAMES galore! And the best part is that I can give this to my 6 year old and not worry about him being able to surf the internet, or download anything he's not supposed to. The limitations were so easy to set too. I know this was the right choice for us and we couldn't be happier. And because of all the choices of applications/games etc I know this will last us a few years too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got her tablet in November and it has been problem after problem. You’d think for $200 this would be, for the most part, a decent tablet. But this tablet turns off and on at the most random times. My daughter will be watching a video and it shuts off randomly. It takes FOREVER to charge, and the charge doesn’t hold. We plug it in at night and in the morning unplug it and the battery drains even if it’s just sitting there on the counter, not having been used the whole day.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Mercado

customer_reviews.title: will the 2 year warranty actually be Worry Free.... let's find out 6.3.2020
customer_reviews.text: It's was great until it stopped Charging recently. I purchased this in June 2018 with a 2year worry free warranty & recently the tablet stopped charging without any prior charging issues. I tried the normal method of returning and it says that the window has closed as of June 2019. So I contacted Support & they started a warranty service request for my Fire tablet. With the instructions to send my device in so it can be checked by their technicians. They emailed me my pre- paid return label and I will box it up and ship it out tomorrow and keep you updated on what happens as I seen there are alot of concerns over the warranty issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Montana

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, looks great, very durable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has autism disorder 3, and she breaks everything. We can’t have any lamps or decorative items in our house, or she will kill them. This tablet has been abused - she has thrown, stomped on, punched and stood on this thing and it still works fine. The protective covering works. It also had a bunch of great kids content ready to go on an easy to use kid friendly interface. You get a one year subscription included and it’s worth it not to have to look around for stuff. This is a great buy for parents of kids who like to break things.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schadow

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my granddaughter (she isn’t quite old enough yet) to watch videos on road trips. Our older (2.5) grandson has one that he loves and uses daily. Completely live these tablets! I purchased two others for my other grandsons, and have recommended them to my friends. Setup is easy. The age based access is wonderful. Excellent tool for learning. Easy for toddlers to navigate and get to different apps, books, and videos. The warranty is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette S

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Many glitches with the apps. Stopped turning on with a month of having it.
customer_reviews.author: R.S.

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy software
customer_reviews.text: Software on this thing makes it only useable maybe 40% of the time. We bought this thing for our daughter who is autistic and we have already replaced it once through amazons service which is a lot of hoops and ladders to even Make use of a service that they provide. Both of them the apps crash tablet freezes have to do almost constant hard resets tough screen doesn’t respond right list goes on. This is one of those per chases that I honestly regret and wish I would have spent the extra money on a tablet worth while for her.
customer_reviews.author: Platt

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and great tablet
customer_reviews.text: Awesome customer service is the first thing i am going to say about this. When they say worry-free guarantee they truly mean it. My daughter broke the screen on it 2 weeks after owning it and they instantly replaced the tablet. Other than the battery life we love this tablet and are happy that we bought it!
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Super durable, great fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is amazing! My then 3 year old loves this tablet! With the kid tough case this tablet can really take a beating, as we know kids are not careful! They have a great warranty on them as well plus a free year of FreeTime unlimited! Even after your year is up, freetime is extremely affordable! So many learning games and you can add content to the child profile from the adult profile any time! All around love this tablet and would absolutely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Katie B

customer_reviews.title: This is so much bigger and better than Fire hd 8
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned hd 8 and believe me this one looks significantly huge than that one. Bigger and better... so much faster and still have all the benefits of kids fire hd... although they could have improved on the camera as well but again that’s secondary.. much use will be on screen apps and content and parental controls which are so much essential and of course their no worry policy with kids tablet .. what not to love about it ...?? Wish the price would be slightly lower.. It’s everything you will look for a gadget for your kid...
customer_reviews.author: heer

customer_reviews.title: Awful awful awful.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason it even gets one star is because the screen size. The update has been awful. Not only that is it freezes CONSTANTLY and is really glitchy. We constantly get an "Oops something went wrong" error and have to refresh it (if we are lucky to get that option)or have to reboot it altogether. Not only that, when we try to open an application, it will refresh the app, but never open it - time for another reboot. Wait to buy until it's a bit older and the kinks are out.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Worst tablet I’ve bought!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has proved to be more difficult than I hoped for and I’m so upset I let my return time pass. I understand the security measures but everything doesn’t require a parent to do on a tablet and why is it so hard to figure out if the screen will lock or not. Will never buy another of these tablets EVER!
customer_reviews.author: AshD

customer_reviews.title: We would be lost without the Kindle
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old absolutely loves her Kindle and is lost without it. I love the fact that I can control what content she is able to see, how long she's able to use it for and that I can switch to my account if needed. Recently she cracked the screen and luckily the kids Kindle Table comes with a 2 year warranty. I shipped it out and within a few days I received notice that they were unable to replace the cracked screen and sent a new/refurbished one. The whole process from start to finish maybe took a week. Absolutely love this....especially with a toddler who misses their Kindle!
customer_reviews.author: msorg28

customer_reviews.title: It’s really big
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize how big this was. I think the 8 would’ve been a better size. Of course they love it! It’s heavy because of the size. I’m happy with it though. They had the 6 before and now they just think it’s so cool that it’s huge. Battery last longer than the 6 of course. Still wish there was a way to connect to internet like a phone. Like pair it up with my phone . If we are out and there isn’t an internet that we know the password to, a lot of the videos and games won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: kel

customer_reviews.title: So happy and stress free with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet for my 2 year old. I especially love the 2 year worry-free guarantee! Initially, I bought a regular tablet, not the kids edition, and my son broke it within 3 months.. a few days AFTER the warranty expired. I didn’t buy this one at first, because I didn’t think it was a fully functional tablet, but it definitely is. GREAT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.author: Aislinn kramer

customer_reviews.title: Lazy Driver for UPS! Delivering for Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is my second tablet (for 2nd daughter..both for Christmas)... The tablets are well built and solid. They will handle a decent drop, but obviously best to avoid falls. The aggravation of adding Playstore should have been unnecessary, but that's Amazon vs Google for ya. It does work well, after installed assuming you do it correctly. I would avoid UPS, though, this driver can't even figure out a simple slide lock and yes, 30 sec after he left it was RAINING!! unprotected 3 feet from a covered porch!!
customer_reviews.author: wernerb

customer_reviews.title: If you like buying packing materials and running to a UPS store this is the tablet for you!
customer_reviews.text: Worst tablet ever! I have 3 and I have returned one 6 times, one 5 times and one twice. They seem to last 2 months. If you purchase this, buy a printer and stock in packaging materials for the numerous returns. Completely fed up with this model. Go for the HD8 kids tablet it seems to last 6 months longer.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Great full functional tablet. I purchased this to replace a older 7 inch kids tablet. Battery life seems to be much better than the 7 inch. The 1 year of included free time is a very good value. The included case protector provides very good protection against the occasional drop. I added a screen protector to help prevent a scratched screen. I added a 64 GB SD card for added storage. The parent controls are a nice addition however it did take me a little time to get used to authorizing app's etc.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Kids enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: We have two Fire HD 10 Kids Edition Tablet, 10.1" 1080p Full HD Display, 32 GB for our grandchildren - both have different covers so we can tell them apart (Blue for one/Pink for the other). The tablet holds battery easily and seems to quickly recharge when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and “blue shade” feature is a plus!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something for my 2 year for an 8 hour flight and traveling abroad. I’m against so much technology so young, but this is a LIFESAVER!!!!! The blue shade feature reduces the blue light, which is a big plus!!! She’s dropped it twice and it’s perfectly fine. One of the best things we’ve ever purchased. Don’t forget to also get the case with the stand!
customer_reviews.author: Kalielbw

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old son. I love that I can put educational requirements that are perfect for him. He has never been a reader but since recieving this tablet, I can see a huge difference in his reading abilities! If you have multiple kids and tablets, I love that you can access them all from one device (as long as they are all linked to the same account). You can even set time restrictions and control the content that they have access to.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Whitt

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for toddler AS IS
customer_reviews.text: TOO MANY APPS AND VIDEOS! This far exceeeds American Physicians Association recommendations for screen time. I have the 2-3 yr old settings on and it still offers unlimited access to completely INAPPROPRIATE content. After going through parental controls and removing 900 apps, there are still MORE for my toddler to choose from. Canceling all Amazing freetime and only using audible. Also I bought this because it came with 3yr protection, but now I cannot even get the screen replaced after less than one year, CRACKED screen from gentle use in September and can't get my replacement screen. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaLou

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kids tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Kids absolutely love their tablets, and the cases work really well for when the drop them(happens alot in my house). We have 3, blue,pink, and yellow. Had to return one due to a cracked screen, and they replaced it with absolutely no hassle with the 2 year worry free warranty. Love how it goes with their age for the content, and has an "adult" side where you can manage the software and videos they watch. After 4 months of use, they are still charging and working well, so I have to say we are happy with this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Zero battery life!!
customer_reviews.text: The battery last about a day so disappointed I spent this much money on this!! Shoukd have bought an ipad. My daughter only gets to play with this twice a day and the battery het drained so fast.
customer_reviews.author: cassy

customer_reviews.title: Tablet shuts down
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE everything about this tablet except the fact that it randomly freezes and shuts down. I spoke to some friends who have one and they have not had that issue so i definitely think it make be an issue with our particular device. With that said, my daughter loves the games, books, and videos she can watch on it. I love the parental controls and the fact that she can't just access whatever she wants. It really is a great buy! Just wish ours didn't shut down sometimes and wish it had more space as my daughter ran out of space pretty quickly. But she has SO many games and books on it.
customer_reviews.author: Haleigh Sturrock

customer_reviews.title: Plug-ins and beter tutorials
customer_reviews.text: I found that the input charger cable has some difficulty in inserting the cable to the Fire Ten[10]. the protective wrap around to the frame is not spread out enough. Thus a little twist and mechanical maneuvering will the connection get full insert to the Fire 10. I notice I could not find a complete reset to change the names and age on both units. I do have 2 Fire 10's. perhaps, I will call for .technical support???? Bhrama LLama
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids
customer_reviews.text: We shopped around for a tablet for our 9 year old. They use them so much at school and we decided to get one for the house for her. At first she wanted the 7", but after spending time with a wonderful Amazon associate at one of the stores we opted for the bigger screen. So glad we followed her recommendation - it definitely makes a difference! And we love the worry-free kid content. Perfect for any age - it's great that you can set the age and then appropriate content is available. Definitely recommend - in the bigger screen. It's surprisingly light and the case if very protective.
customer_reviews.author: SophieMom

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2.5 yr old granddaughter. I thought she might be a little young but I needed something to hold her attention when we attend my 14 yr old daughters karate competitions. At the last competition there was a boy with a tablet and she wouldn't leave his side all day. We're there most of the day and her toys/books only hold her attention for so long. She learned how to navigate the menu quickly and now the only thing I need to do is sign her in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for a 2 y/o.
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for a 2 y/o. (I purchased a different case for the baby) He loves it. I give it 3 stars instead of 4 because some elements are confusing, and or don't work properly. For instance, when I move a game or book to Favorites, they are then in 2 places instead of just in Favorites. When I try to remove an app from the device, it doesn't work and the app stays. And, some of the apps in "Free Time" won't download. These are minor issues, as they don't interfere with the baby's fun. All in all, I really like Kindle Fire. I have 3 of them - one for each child.
customer_reviews.author: #1Amazon-Aholic

customer_reviews.title: Garbage: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I like amazon but this item is not great. one year warranty(just saw it was actually supposed to be 2 years no?) which ended august 17th 2019. battery is dead. they won't even fix for a fee. I don't recommend at all. I saw same complains from years ago with kindle fire but still bought this because I thought they would have fix problem by now. IN A BOX WAITING TO BE RECYCLED.
customer_reviews.author: Eme B

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So i purchased this as an upgrade for my 5 year old for Christmas. It wouldnt connect to wifi and ended up having to reorder. The only pain was downloading the content to her tablet. I wish amazon had a better and easier way to do that. Love the size and she is loving it, which is important. So far so good but we have only had it a few weeks. I will keep you updated.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Special needs children it’s an A+!
customer_reviews.text: My son (non verbal autistic) had the GEN8 before and it was WAY more durable. This one didn’t last bit 2 months! However it’s so large and cool I don’t mind using the warranty and just getting it replaced. He LOVES IT! It’s definitely a daily MUST HAVE in my household so he’ll always have that quiet time with his tablet. Amazon Freetime is a godsend! He’s learned how to spell so many words and has learned how to navigate it so easily. Any special needs children I recommend this to since he refuses to be around peers, It’s his best friend that’s super educational!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Rosskopf Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Super High Quality Tablet and Low Price for High Quality
customer_reviews.text: My son's first tablet. We were having difficulties to limit him from our mobile phones. Currently, we can control what he watches and how long he watches. The free subscription to the content is a very good benefit because we do not have to buy new books or pay for the games. This version is very fast and I did not have any problem with the downloading/streaming time. The extended warranty made me feel comfortable to buy this tablet. An advice would be improving parent dashboard in terms of detailed selection of games, videos and books.
customer_reviews.author: ISAT

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Our children are 5 & 3 and got these as Christmas gifts. We are totally unhappy with these tablets. The updated “free time” is terribly difficult for either child to navigate. One tablet worked for 5 days and suddenly is dead, won’t charge, & won’t power on at all. The other tablet’s power button is extremely difficult to press off/on & takes some strength to get to work. We will be returning both tablets for a refund, hopefully. These are terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kellogg family

customer_reviews.title: Per Our Newly 8 Year Old: BEST BIRTHDAY PRESENT EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is our year to gift our grandkids with their own tablets for their birthdays - one got the Fire 7 last month, one got the Fire HD 10 this month, next month we will be gifting two Fire 8s. Gotta tell you: this is our eight year old grandsons favorite thing EVER!! He’s had zero issues, it kept him out of his mom’s hair while the schools closed due to bad weather this week, he’s thrilled to have free reign with the included AmazonKids content. My ONLY complaint? It looks like the price dropped $40 a week after I bought it. Boo!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

product_meta.title: Fire HD 10 Kids Edition Tablet, 10.1" 1080p Full HD Display, 32 GB, Blue Kid-Proof Case (Previous Generation - 7th)
feature_bullets: Up to $99 in savings on Fire HD 10 tablet, 1 year of Amazon FreeTime Unlimited, and a Kid-Proof Case, versus items purchased separately - plus a 2-year worry-free guarantee.

Not a toy, a full-featured Fire HD 10 tablet with a brilliant 10.1" 1080p Full HD display (1920 x 1200), 32 GB internal storage, and up to 10 hours of mixed-use battery life. Add a microSD card for up to 256 GB of expandable storage.

The included 1 year of FreeTime Unlimited gives your kids access to over 20,000 popular apps and games, videos, books, Audible books, and educational content from PBS Kids, Nickelodeon, Disney, and more. Your subscription will then automatically renew every month starting at just $2.99 per month plus applicable tax. You may cancel at any time by visiting the Amazon Parent Dashboard or contacting Customer Service.
2-year worry-free guarantee: If it breaks, return it and we'll replace it for free.

Introducing Spanish language content in FreeTime Unlimited, kids can now enjoy over 1,000 books, movies, and apps in Spanish that include titles and characters like Sesamo, Dora, Diego, Frozen, and more.

Our largest display, now with over 2 million pixels, stereo speakers, Dolby Audio, and dual-band 802.11ac Wi-Fi?perfect for watching Full HD videos, playing games, reading books, and streaming content seamlessly.
Add even more content to your child's profile in FreeTime to give them selected access to apps in your personal library, such as Netflix and Minecraft.

Easy-to-use parental controls allow parents to personalize screen time limits, set educational goals, filter age-appropriate content, and also manage web browsing and content usage. Parental controls can be set on device or online through Amazon Parent Dashboard. Additionally, access all tablet features in the adult profile by entering your passcode.
